page.title: 06INDUSTRY
page.content: Three major trends can be detected in Sunderland's industry, all pertinent to block D. Firstly, there is the ongoing shift away from traditional industries (shipbuilding and its associated industries) towards other forms of manufacturing. Associated with this is the second trend - a change in spatial emphasis away from the river sides, towards more accessible sites out of the centre of the town and the block. Thirdly, there has been an overall decline in employment in the town, related to the decline in traditional industries. Evidence of industrial decay is very apparent within the block, with many disused factories and warehouses. Yet more have been demolished and some sites have been given over to non-industrial activities.
